MethaneSpectrumAssignment.title: The v4 IR Spectrum of Methane

subPoints: Excellent implementation of the double Gaussian model function.
Properly utilized scipy.optimize.curve_fit for parameter optimization.
Correctly identified and applied initial guesses for amplitudes and centers from the provided spectrum.
Very well done on implementing 'bound' constraints to ensure physically meaningful parameters.
Successfully determined the optimized standard deviation (sigma) for the peaks.
Efficiently loaded the spectral data using Pandas.
Correctly extracted wavenumber and absorbance values as NumPy arrays for processing.
Proper labeling of axes (Wavenumber cm-1 vs Absorbance) and legend usage.
Accurate calculation of the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) using root finding or the Gaussian relationship.
The FWHM value matches the expected result (ca. 0.352 cm-1).
Consider using the 'bounds' parameter in curve_fit to prevent non-physical results (e.g., negative widths).
Equation error: The Gaussian function does not match the provided Equation 2.
Parameter mismatch: The model function should take exactly 7 arguments (x + 6 parameters).
Convergence failure: curve_fit did not converge, likely due to poor initial guesses (p0).
Missing Plot: No visualization was provided to verify the fit quality.
Plotting only data: You plotted the raw data but did not overlay the optimized model curve.
Formatting: The plot lacks axis lables or units on the x-axis (cm-1).
Incorrect FWHM: The calculated FWHM value is far from the expected 0.3519 cm-1.
Logic Error: FWHM should be calculated using the optimized sigma for Peak 1.
Root finding failed: The scipy.optimize.root function was not used.
Root finding failed: The scipy.optimize.root function did not find the half-maximum points correctly.
